title: Emulators Unlimited FBRBITS
description:
Hello again dear internet users. This is FBRBITS.

Our first public release was "52 Complete No-Intro ROM sets FBRBITS".
That huge release had some roms from old consoles etc.

Now we are back with some emulators to play those roms with :)

This is Emulators.Unlimited-FBRBITS

Some nfo about the source:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EMULATORS UNLIMITED
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Emu On CD - October, 21st, 2002
			       
1 - INTRODUCTION
    ------------

Welcome to EMULATORS UNLIMITED. The development of this package is still in very early 
stages, nevertheless, you can find most of the emulators ever published for the PC in
here already. Also the bioses you'll need to run emulators on your PC.

Everything is splitted into folders, so it is easy for you to find out what you'll need.

2 - REQUIREMENTS
    ------------

To run the emulators inside this CD in your computer you'll need:

	a) Knowledge on how to run emulators in a computer. Most emulators are tricky to
           to run, and they need to be unzipped and set up before work.

	b) Games roms - no games are provided in this CD. You'll either will have to find 
           the ROMs you need, or buy one of the EMU ON CD ROMs CDs.

	c) Read the documentation - 99% of the emulators are provided with accurate docs
           inside their ZIPs teaching how to set up them. Read it carefully and you will
           have no problems.

        d) Winzip - You'll need Winzip to unpack the emulators onto your Hard-drive.


3 - SET-UP HINTS
    ------------

	1) Search the folder for the system which you want to emulate. First search for
           the system type (Arcade, Computer, Console, Hand-held or even Multi-emulators).

	2) Go to the folder and find the emulator you want.

           i.e.: CONSOLES -> ATARI 2600 -> z26v157x.zip

	3) Unzip the file in your HD in a separate folder.

        4) Follow the instructions on the emulator's README.TXT to know how to make it 
           run for you. Probably you'll need the game ROMs in a folder called ROMS or
           something, plus the BIOS (if the system requires it).

4 - THE BIOS FILES
    --------------

You can find BIOS files for most of the emulators in the BIOS folders under:

	MULTI-EMULATORS -> MESS -> BIOS

Just in case you need them. http://fbrbits.net/
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
